title: Fun little mini to paint
text: Make sure you get the metal version, not the plastic one, since the metal one has a little sharper details.  It's approximately 35mm tall.  A few parts of the sculpt on this mini are a little sloppy (like others mentioned), such as his ears, but overall it's a pretty good little mini for the price and a helpful one to practice painting skin/flesh, which can be tricky.  Have a little extra fun by adding a tattoo, details on the cloak, or whatever you want.  Mine arrived unbroken, but if yours breaks it's an easy fix with a little hobby glue - or you can return/exchange free from Amazon, since they always take care of their customers.

title: Great mini Vader
text: This Vader miniature is about 4 cm tall (a bit bigger than the 32mm listed)  or a little more with the base.  It features fairly accurate detail given the small size.  Not much hobby knife work is needed for mold lines and stuff.  I recommend painting the helmet and cloak separately, as they will be tough to paint once assembled.  Happy with the way this miniature turned out.

title: Just like the originals
text: Your kids WILL lose some of the original balls, so order these with the game when you buy it.

title: Nice product except for paint.
text: For any little girl into art and Disney/Frozen, this easel will be perfect.  My little one loves this and will probably use for several years.  It seems fairly sturdy, except for the baskets/shelf at the bottom.  It looks about the same as the photo and was fairly easy to assemble, with step-by-step picture directions included.  You will need a multi-screwdriver (ideally electric) to assemble.  The white-side is a dry-erase board that is magnetic.  This easel includes a magnetic Olaf puzzle (9 or 12 pieces) and magnetic alphabet.  The Black side is a non-magnetic blackboard, which will probably not be used much, and no chalk is included.  I rate this 4 stars because of the paint issues (see my attached photos).  First, the paint has a strong nasty smell that will fill your apartment and last for days, maybe longer.  Second, paint is missing/chipped on some edges (photo), roughly textured in some spots (photo), and other colors are smudged in some places (photo) to give this a classic made-in-China look.  Only the paint on the Elsa/Anna art at the top is nice.  Whoever painted this is worse at painting than my 5 year old is.  Overall, it's still a nice gift and a good price, but expect some paint flaws and a strong smell if you buy this.

title: Great bath toys for a little girl
text: Great price and my little girl loves to play with these during her baths.  Squirting her parents with water never seems to get old.

title: A small price to pay to save your wallpaper!
text: My 4-year-old loves this marker set, but historically she has not always colored where she is supposed to.  If I had bought these markers (washable) long ago, I would have saved some money on wallpaper.  Besides being washable, there is quite a nice, thorough variety of colors.  Even though the markers are thin (like a standard pen) they seem to last quite a bit longer than the cheap dollar store marker sets.  I would (and will) buy this again and I think the "washable" factor will more than pay for itself if you have young kids.

title: A dull purple
text: Besides the horrible GW paint pot, I found the color to be disappointing, too.  It looks like a vivid purple in the photo, but is rather dull when painted - almost as if someone took a purple paint and mixed in some gray.  I would not buy this again, and I think most purple paints would be better.

title: Perfect for a 2 or 3 year old
text: My little daughter loves this toy!  It's maybe 1 1/2 feet tall or so, and leans back and forth while singing.  The sound quality is pretty good - not Dolby but not terrible.  It looks just like the photo.  While the outside is soft, there is a hard mechanical part inside so it could potentially break a TV or hurt someone if thrown.  Don't forget to get batteries before it arrives so he/she can use it immediately.

title: A very sturdy door basketball hoop
text: After unboxing, I was immediately impressed with the sturdiness of the construction.  The hoop is solid metal and the backboard feels sturdy and strong, too.  I doubt this would ever break under normal use, unless your kids try to hang on it.  The balls have all held their inflation well after a few months, too, and you get 4 of them.  The only minor issue is that the ball-to-rim size ratio is not very forgiving, so it can be bit hard for your little ones to make baskets.  Would be nice if it had an extra bracket for height adjustment.  Still, I think this is a great set and great price.

title: Very thin - looks cheap
text: These bases are very thin and look too cheap to use on display quality minis.  They are suitable for board games, though, but I wish they were a lot thicker.

title: A beautiful, vibrant blue.
text: This paint is probably the most vivid medium-blue I've ever seen - I really love this color!  As it's a contrast paint - NOT a normal paint - you have to be more careful about how you apply it.  Apply a very thin coat (or even partly diluted with water or medium) for a bright blue (assuming a white/light undercoat) or more thickly for a medium blue with dark crevices/details.  I like this one more than most of my contrast paints (except for Snakebite Leather - which is the best) and would recommend this one if you are looking for a brilliant blue that can be applied in various brightness levels/shades.

title: Good for painting practice, mediocre quality.
text: In the age of 4K 3D printers, it's about time for Reaper to update their mold technology.  Having mostly male figures in my collection, I decided to add some female figures, including this one.  It's a tiny mini (about 30mm) but the detail/definition is mediocre considering today's 3D printing technology.  Still, this model is good to practice painting female skin, which can be a bit tricky.  Would also be suitable as a board game piece - but remember to prime it first before painting.

title: Green stuff
text: For anyone who has never used this, it is an epoxy putty that is used for filling gaps/blemishes and even minor sculpting for plastic miniatures.  You cut off as much as you need, thoroughly mix the green and blue, shape and apply it, then wait for it to harden.  It takes several hours at minimum to harden.  The consistency is very thick, sort of like a clay/rubber mix.  I wish this company made a softer version (like Milliput) for filling tiny cracks.  When dried, Green Stuff does not sand well, so make sure you have it exactly how you want it before it dries.  It does stick really well, though, and being able to sculpt/shape it is nice.

title: Fantastic basic paint set - will buy again.
text:
Vallejo paints are known to be one of the top brands of paints for minis, and after using this set I can see why. The paints all come smoothly out of the bottle (tested each one) and most hold their consistency well. What stands out to me is the pigments - they are finer and probably more concentrated than many brands, so you are able to thin your paints a bit more for layering and glazing.

A couple notes on individual colors: The fur brown is more watery than the other paints, but when dried produces an interesting matte texture similar to fur. So, it's kind of an effects paint. Some of the darker colors like the green and blue can look almost black when too thick, which can be great for shading, but maybe tricky if you're wanting a uniform color. They're almost like a contrast paint, imo. The metallics are great - shiny, and not a weird hue. Best of all, the white in this set is amazing for whites and easily my favorite white (not off-white) of the 4 white brands I own. As you may know, white paints are tricky to paint with because they tend to be chalky, uneven, and sometimes clumpy due to the nature of the white pigments used. But this Vallejo Dead White is the smoothest, nicest, most uniform white I've tried. When it runs out, I'll buy it again.

Although Vallejo paints are a bit more expensive than many competing brands, I do believe they are high quality and more consistent as well after trying this set. I wish it included a purple instead of 2 browns, but that's a minor thing since you can mix a purple if needed.

That being said, for beginner painters it's nice to have colors/shades pre-mixed in order to plan a color scheme. It would be nice if Vallejo made a set bigger than 16, but not quite so big as their 72pc set. For anyone wanting more than these 16 colors (me!) you have to either get the 72pc set or buy colors individually. Anyway, this set is a great place to start for beginners OR experienced painters wanting to upgrade to a premium quality paint.

title: A beautiful, detailed mini
text: This miniature is well-sculpted and has a lot of nice little details for it's size (~30mm) so it will take a bit more time to paint than others minis of the same size, but will look great if you take your time and do a good job.  Nothing was broken, bent, misshapen, or poorly sculpted on my copy, which is plastic.

title: My daughter loves these!
text: This is a great introductory paint set if you have a young little princess that is interested in art.  Mine really enjoyed painting these and wishes there were more princess/female themed figures to paint (not farm animals or whatever like most sets).  Unfortunately (and stupidly) the paint set includes does not include a flesh tone, so good luck mixing that.  The other issue is the cheap plaster models chip and break VERY easily, so be extra careful not to break them - they are very fragile.  The included brushes don't have sharp tips, so you might need to get her a better brush to paint the eyes and details.  Still, a fun set for little girls to enjoy.

title: Nice details, but bent sword :(
text: First, this mini is about 28mm tall, as expected.  (I *HATE* how mini sellers list the scale but NOT the actual size!  NOT useful!!!). This model is made of pewter, not plastic.  The tiny details are really nice, and I would give it 5 stars except mine has a bent sword.  The sword in the photo appears straight.  But the one I received, the blade is bent approximately  15 or 20 degrees starting about 1/3 of the way up the blade.  Also, the end of the sword handle appears out of place.  So, the sword looks really weird and makes mine look like it was made in China.

title: Broke within days, but still usable
text: I bought this for use in our above ground swimming pool. It worked just as it should, in the beginning. However, the first time I went to twist it up to store away, something snapped. It has been wonky ever since. I dont know if I did it wrong or what. I still use it to float, because its all I've got. I do love that it airs up and deflates easily. My sister bought one of these and never had an issue with twisting hers up. So maybe it is user error?

title: 1 year later- still happy.
text: I bought 2 pairs of these to anchor our wooden play set. We moved it from our old house and it didn't seem as sturdy in the new yard. Also our kids are getting bigger. They work great, easy to install, arrived quickly, and after being in the ground for over a year they are still in place. I am very pleased.

title: Definitely NOT for toddlers who chew!
text: These are basically just foam balls that float on top of water. Seem to be made from the same stuff as the knee pad I use for gardening. My two eldest daughters liked these okay, but as soon as my 2 year old got her hands on one it was basically ruined. She bit a chunk right out of it. I should've seen that coming. Next, we had a 10-year-old neighbor child over to play who proceeded to tear the orange one up into about six pieces when I wasn't looking. Said she wanted to pretend they were makeup sponges for their mermaid game in the pool. My point is, make sure whoever you allow to touch these things is both mature enough and cares enough about your pocket book not to demolish it.

title: Must buy for any child, any occasion
text: Really great idea. I use these without any water to keep my 10 month old and 2 year old occupied, sticking them to the storm door or window in the living room.  And of course we use them in the bath, where they entertain my 8 year old as well. They seem very sturdy; I do not foresee having to replace them any time soon. For the money, this is a must buy for any child on any occasion. Wish we had 2 or 3 sets of these bad boys!

title: Keeping my 3 kiddos entertained during our Arkansas rainy season
text: This toy is awesome. It's really great for the whole family. Earlier today, our 2 and 8 year old daughters were arguing with each other for their turns on this thing. I even watched my (supported) 10 month old take a crack at it. We've had grown adults sneak on for a try. Good luck keeping anyone off of it for very long! Money WELL spent.

title: Great toy. My 8 and 2 yr olds both enjoy playing together with this!
text: I love this toy. Bought as a Christmas for my 2 year old daughter who loves "helping" mom and dad with tools, fixing and building things. It will take her a little practice to use the tools included with the set. For now, she is doing a good job putting the wooden pieces together by twisting the little nuts & bolts with her fingers, and I help her by tightening them. Set comes with ideas on what to build, which my daughter is a little too young to use. But they are VERY good instructions, stating which wooden pieces to use and how many of each. Nuts and bolts are plastic.

title: Love that this thing is not hollow plastic!!!
text:
Sturdy, solid plastic, which I love. I did not want a hollow one! Easy to install on our wooden play gym in the back yard. PlayStar is a really good brand that I trust with my kids safety. Our swings, slide, and all brackets and braces on our wooden swing set/play gym are all PlayStar brand. Good quality, and holds up really well against the elements and our wild thangs!
I only wish it had a horn. Almost took a star away for it's lack of a horn, but I knew going in that it didn't have one and still thought it was the best bet. My daughter noticed immediately that there was no horn and I think she'd really like a steering wheel that had one. But overall, is a good buy

title: Went flat in one day, sitting in a box!
text: Bought as a Christmas present for my daughter. I blew it up couple of days ago to check it out and next day it was flat. It was sitting in a box hidden in our garage. Or want even played with or touched!!! I am so irritated. I ordered a bounce-on ball for my 8 year old. Hoping I didn't order from the same company!!! I'll be returning this ASAP

title: Great party game/ice breaker, for teens and adults!
text: Bought this for my nephew, 11, and cousin, 17, for Christmas. It was a big hit at the Christmas party last night involving my nephew! I think said nephew is a little young for this- he was scared to try it after watching his 15 year old sister yelp after getting shocked by the game. But it was definitely entertaining for all of us to watch this game being played. We were just about rolling on the floor laughing watching the grown men's reactions to the impending shock! I'm glad I ordered two of these and I'll consider buying more if another occasion arises. You can pick the number of players, from 14. Each player holds a 'joystick' while the machine plays suspenseful music and the light flashes red. Once the light turns green, the last player to press their button gets shocked! Just a couple of quick FYI's: One player found out the hard way that if you push the button early to avoid being last, it shocks you immediately! Also, a listing I saw here on Amazon mentioned a medium setting. However, I only saw regular and intense settings.

title: Very little red wagon, good for indoor
text: Opening the box, I was shocked to find this little wagon inside! I was in a hurry and didn't check the dimensions when I ordered it. I had about 10 other items coming too so I didn't expect the wagon to be in this little box lol. My initial reaction was to send it back because we need something bigger for our daughters to haul things (and each other) around our big back yard. But after checking it out, I decided to keep it because it seems VERY durable and I think it will be great for indoor play.  I love the simple, solid plastic body. It's really exactly the kind of wagon I've been wanting for outside, only its about 4x too small and the handle can't be used to steer it by someone riding it. The handle is fixed, so you have to drag the wagon along the floor or ground to turn it.  The girls have been having a blast pulling each other up and down the hallway, despite the fact that my 9 month old is the only one who fits inside comfortably. And it's not tearing up or scratching my hardwood floors, either, which is a def plus. I guess all in all, good buy considering the price. And my hunt for the perfect outdoor wagon for us continues!

title: Gifting this for Christmas? Packaged as a dead giveaway!!(
text: This being a Christmas present, we have not hung or used it yet. I am very excited to try it out for myself though, when the time comes! That being said GIFT BUYING PARENTS BEWARE: THIS COMES IN A BOX COVERED WITH A HUGE PICTURE OF THE SWING IN ACTION, smiling children riding the thing and all! Luckily I caught this on the porch before my 2.5 or 8 year old daughters did!!!

title: Disappointed
text: Costume runs extremely small.  The cape would not attach to the costume and had a tear in the material.  Disappointed.

title: Great party favors
text: Fun ducks that we used as kid's grab bag party favors for our family Superbowl party.

title: Fun Barbie Accessory
text: My two year old granddaughter enjoys putting her "exercise Barbie" on the bike and scooting around on the floor with it.  She seems to enjoy this toy more than the Barbie kitchen, schoolroom or dentist sets.

title: Five Stars
text: My Godson loves this play hut.

title: Five Stars
text: It was a gift and my little niece loved it.

title: Good  craft
text: It's a little confusing but really great quality beads string and keychain really fun craft great value

title: Creepy
text: Creepy

title: Scary and Hideous
text: Hideous hideous hideous hideous hideous hideous even more hideous

title: SUPER! CUTE!!!!
text:
I am a kid who loves this stuffed animal my grand ma got this for me and it is the best ever
I hope you thought this was helpful it's a great toy!!!!!!!!!

title: Better than expected!
text: This actually is a fantastic piece of equipment.  You can tighten the slackline at the bottom and let kids walk across, or loosen it so the kids dangle from the attachments.  My children have been very aggressive on it, and it barely budges.  Excellent quality, easy to assemble, fun attachments.  I would recommend it to everyone.

title: good clean fun
text: We haven't totally gotten the hang of it, but we still love the game.

title: hours of fun!
text: My 7 year old loves this game!  So much fun!

title: great kit, highly recommend.
text: I love this kit but I hate that all the little gadgets that make noise don't come with their own batteries.  Super annoying because I never expected noisy gadgets to begin with.  Other than that, it's a great kit with well made parts.  A little tricky for kids to open on their own though.

title: great puzzle!
text: 3 year old daughter LOVES this puzzle.

title: Cute but glitchy
text: Great idea for kids who feel ready for a phone but are too young. No video recording or phone call ability but cute. Probably too expensive for what you get.

title: TOTAL SCAM
text: Way fake. Don't bother. Not even decent knockoffs. No '7 layers of surprises'. Dolls aren't even assembled. These are definite sweat shop scams made with tears of children.

title: All the same character.
text: No trolls. Just the cloud. Times 3.

title: WAY TOO SMALL
text: I ordered a small for sizes 6-10 it said. It wouldn't even fit a size 4 at it's widest. It's super cute, but beware of sizing! !

title: Suspicious and inaccurate
text: Was under the impression that these were full bricks not half bricks also the packaging has many spelling errors and the baking instructions are wrong Fimo clay bakes best at 215F for 30 minuets per 1/4inch thickness. I wanted this for making and selling my clay crafts as I have many colors that needed replenished. Sorely disappointed. I will try the clay but my expectations are very low at this point.

title: Great unicorn favor
text: A great deal, my daughter loves these slap bands. They are ideal as party favors for her unicorn birthday.

title: Great for kids
text: My daughter loves these letters.

title: Easy decorations
text: Great buy

title: Five Stars
text: Excellent item quick delivery.

title: Pretty
text: Had to redo ribbons but this was good for a larger person who wants wings

title: Perfect Set
text: This is just the thing I needed for a teenage boy who wants to start painting and couldn't invest a lot in supplies. The basic colors are included and being a brand name, I am comfortable with the quality.

title: Good Value
text: Nice, clear pictures. My Mom loves these with the letters on the back. If she gets stuck, she can look at the back to find the letter that she needs. Gorgeous graphics. Fun for all ages.

title: Fun Puzzle For Elderly
text: Nice, clear pictures. My Mom loves these with the letters on the back. If she gets stuck, she can look at the back to find the letter that she needs.

title: Beautiful Puzzle
text: Lovely sentiment and gorgeous artwork combine to make a fun jigsaw puzzle for anyone to do. My elderly Mother was really excited to get this.  Sturdy pieces.

title: I'm Not Smart Enough
text: Apparently, I am not as smart as I thought. After an hour of fussing with this and taking it off and starting over, I was unable to make it work. It is well made, but the instructions could be written a bit better. Maybe even a suggestion of an easy pattern to start with for success. Not sure what purpose the base part of this has if any, other than packaging. Really was hoping this would be fun to use, but I wasn't getting it at all.

title: Cleverly Made
text: Very useful. I used this yesterday while working on some gelli printing. Easy to clean up and get the paint off of.

title: Small Pieces
text: Pretty small pieces in this puzzle. Not for an elderly person with poor eyesight. The pieces do fit very tightly together. Nice picture. Good colors, but once again not great for someone with vision and arthritis issues.

title: Super Puzzle
text: Nice pieces and the pattern is actually doable in this large size. The way it is laid out with the different colors in each quadrant makes it easier to figure out.

title: Brutally Difficult
text: This is a gorgeous puzzle. The pieces are thick and easy to pick up. Nice box. Good gift. Fortunately is has a smaller number of pieces because it is very difficult to put together. My elderly Mother has been working on this mostly and we can't even get the edge together. Round puzzles are hard. Once it is finished though it will be a keeper.  Wish they were all made this way.

title: Crumbly
text: This isn't the original formula I don't think. It doesn't smell right. Very crumbly and doesn't seem to want to come together when you work it. Feels weird like a cross between play doh and slime. Parents should be aware that this is going to make a mess.

title: Slick Machine
text: My Mom and I have been playing a lot of Spite and Malice with 2 decks of cards. Shuffling them is a nightmare. Enter this handy gadget. Works as slick as anything ever could. Totally amazing.

title: Brand Name Is Worth It
text: These cards are easy to see, use and open. The wrap on the box is simple to get off.  They are evenly cut and of good quality. If you've been using cheaper cards you will notice a difference.

title: Simply Adorable
text: Everyone needs a smile these days. This little guy will deliver pure happiness with one snuggle.  A great gift for anyone that needs some happy.

title: Very Simple
text: Good educational book with games and information. Spiral bound.  Simplistic artwork. Not for older kids at all. Too simple.

title: Quality Puzzle
text: Nice thick pieces. Sturdy box with  photo sheet included. Fits together well. Really nice colors and graphics.

title: Fantastic!
text: This is what a kit should be. Clear, concise instructions. A practice project so you can get the feel for what you are doing before you start on the bigger piece. Top notch quality from start to finish. A marvel of paper engineering that is so sturdy and rigid when complete that you would think it wasn't paper. The highest quality imaginable in every regard.

title: Tiny Pieces
text: A very thick puzzle.  Overpriced.  Tiny pieces. Poor picture to work from. Going to need a magnifying glass to see the  included diagrams. I would like to see less effort spent on packaging and more on the actual product.

title: Nice Storage Containers
text: These are nice enough for storing pretty much anything from beads to nuts and bolts. 2 sizes that are pretty much good for anything.

title: Nice Tin
text: I sat down to try this kit this afternoon and I'm afraid I have nothing good to say except the storage tin is nice.  The instructions are lacking. There are paper clips included but no mention of what to do with them. The cord that you string on is too thick to go through the beads no matter how much you wax the ends. Inconsistent holes in smaller beads.  Just a bummer. I've made jewelry for 40 years. Getting those beads on that cord didn't work with all the tricks I know. Not sure how kids are supposed to do it.

title: Fab Puzzles
text: I'm starting to really like these puzzles. They have a storage bag to keep the pieces together and I large poster picture to work from. They are also lettered on the back so that you can refer to that if you get stuck and can't find the right piece. They also fit together very tightly so moving them around if you have to is a breeze.

title: Easy To Pour
text: I unmolded my first attempt at these this morning. They came out of the mold very easily.  I learned a couple of things. It takes a little over a cup of resin to do this. Don't go too crazy with the colors and patterns. If you do it makes it really hard to see the dots on the dominos. Finishing them with the lines and the dots is tedious and time consuming. The enclosed bag for storage is nice.

title: Love It
text: The color in these slimes is really rich. Kind of shifts with the light too. Very thick and stretchy. No stickiness. Mesmerizing. Also works great to clean your keyboard.

title: Lovely Puzzle
text: Very colorful. The pieces are a bit thin. They are also all the same which makes it very interesting to put together.

title: Thin Pieces
text: Pieces in this puzzle are well cut but thinner than most. This particular picture is a lot of fun. Focus on all the little critters from corner to corner. Should be fun to do being able to orient by all the vibrant color palette.

title: Nice Enough
text: Interesting graphic style on these puzzles. The pieces are thinner material than what I normally like in a puzzle. They are kind of hard to pick up.  Vibrant colors and a good size of puzzle.

title: Fun For The Littles
text: A great kit that is made from really durable plastic material.  Well thought out and engineered. Several animals can be made from each kit. Looking over the instructions an adult will need to help depending on the age of your child. Or even an older sibling. Something different and fun.

title: Really Brand Specific
text: I wanted to use this for some off brand inks I need to store and They don't fit as well since they are smaller. If you want to put 2 to a slot, one has to be upside down.  If you just put one in they kind of roll around in there.  I have some Ranger inks to store so I think I'll put them in the other side of the container and see how that works.

title: Keep The Sand, Toss The Rest
text: The sand is the only part of this that is worth keeping. The rest of the plastic pieces are not very durable or sturdy. I had difficulty putting it together and can't imagine kids being able to use this on their own.  The dies that go in are hard to place in the grooves. The top part is hard to snap into the bottom. All in all not worth the trouble. The sand didn't seem to do much either, but I attribute that to the very high humidity here right now. They say for best results temperature and humidity should be below 75 and 70%. Not likely in SWVA in the summer.

title: Fun To Watch
text: I decided to try these for some water bead air fresheners. It takes awhile to hydrate them. No instructions are included so I tried cold water first and that didn't seem to be doing it. Switched to warmer water and then let them sit for awhile.  Kind of fun. Just pick a cool clear container and use about 1/2 teaspoon of each color. Then add your fragrance oil.

title: Not All Bands Are Created Equal
text: I 've had the chance to review 2 different sets of these bracelet bands recently. These bands are thicker and not as evenly cut and they kind of stick together.  They also aren't particularly interchangeable with the others I have because of that.  Because they are thinker and have more squared off edges you get a bit of a different look on the bracelet. The instructions in this kit were illegibly printed.  First thing you need is a better crochet hook if you child is old enough. The ones that come in the packs are totally flimsy and useless.

title: If Only..
text: If only the finished projects in diamond painting looked close to the pictures. Alas I find these little sticker type projects fun for when you just need to do something to kill some time. I would love to have some suggestions for using the finished products. This kit has everything you need to make some fun cacti type pieces.

title: Not Resealble
text:
Not your ordinary air dry clay. This stays soft and squishy even after it is dried. Kind of fun to squeeze. This kit comes with tools and eyes and little bits to decorate with. What I don't like is that the clay is not in a container, just a bag that you have to reopen with now way to reseal. They do send resealable bags to use for storage. Seems like it would be less wasteful if they just packaged in them in the first place.

Lots of fun colors. Not a lot of each one so best to get several kits if you have a ton of kids.

title: Instant Gratification
text: Fun smaller pieces that can be completed by kids or adults. Most of the patterns are really fun. The fairies and the butterflies especially. The stickers that have drills on the faces are not great. The area is too small to translate to having diamonds put in.

title: So Much Fun
text: I am an illustrator and painter. I have to admit that playing with this for drawings is a ton of fun. I do trading cards and this is great for smaller style work. Not impressed with the stencils for kids that came. They are nothing like the picture in the description. Very small and they would be hard for kids to use.  This product is easily scratched, so separate the piece you want from the rest of the sheet so as not to damage the rest of the paper. Simply sliding your hand along it if you have rough skin can cause marking. I sealed my work when it was done to make it stable.

title: Just Eh...
text: Kind of drab colors in person. Pieces are not very thick and they have a strange pattern on the back. I suppose that is supposed to help you tell the back from the front. Makes no sense to me. Way too expensive for what it is.

title: Expensive For The Quality
text: Not overly impressed with this one. The colors are muddy and the pieces aren't very thick. The back of the pieces are printed with some kind of numeric graphic I have never seen done on a puzzle before.  Hopefully it will be more impressive once it is together.

title: Nice Ball
text: Seems to be good quality. I got this as a toy for my bunny. It would be great for smaller children to play with.

title: Hard To Use
text: As other people have said the shoe in this isn't heavy enough.

title: Lots of Fun
text: What fun for kids with a minimum of mess. No paint, no crayons, no water, just a pointy wooden stick. They can just scratch off the coating and reveal the colors underneath. A lot of artwork on one page.  A great idea for parties or rainy days.

title: Very Cuddly
text: I'm in love with this latest addition to my bunny collection. So soft and squishy. Hard to see in the photo, but the ears are lined with a fun print fabric that really makes this a cutie.

title: Awesome For Kids
text: I've been an artist for a long time, but always struggled with watercolor. The description of this led me to think that it might help me to improve my watercolor skills. It's a great beginner kit with good information, but not the help I was looking for. Basic watercolor and mixing instructions, using resists and salt etc. Super pages to paint on, but the only pictures of the finished work are on the cover. Still a super kit for a budding artist.

title: Sharp
text: I like these scissors. I never have enough in the studio or the workshop. These cut through cardboard without much effort and did well on paper. Nice handles. Very useful tools.
